channel.title: Partitioning your hard drive in Windows Vista
channel.description:
Windows Vista comes with a built-in partition manager so you don't have to download other software.
1. Open Control Panel 2. In Classic View, open Administrative Tools 3. Open Computer Management 4. Select Disk Management
From there, you can change drive letters and labels. Just right-click a partition or empty space and then pick what you want to do. You can shrink, expand, and create partitions, mount a partition, and view drive properties.

item.title: Partitioning your hard drive in Windows Vista
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

I have 11 gb of unallocated disk space on my hard disk, how do i put this back into my hard drive?

nevermind, figured it out

Read full topic
